thread.title: Bikes, biplanes & baklava: must-see Georgia festivals this month
thread.title_full: Bikes, biplanes & baklava: must-see Georgia festivals this month | AL.com

author: Alabama Media Group Marketing Staff
title: Bikes, biplanes & baklava: must-see Georgia festivals this month
text:
As fall creeps in, the weather becomes prime for outdoor festivals full of food, entertainment and a touch of history. These five Atlanta area activities will keep you busy (and full!) as you take in all the international sights, sounds and snacks that makes DeKalb County , Ga., one of the most ethnically diverse communities in the country.
Buford Highway Bikes and Bites
When: September 12, 8:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m.
Where to Meet: 5114 Buford Highway NE, Doraville, Ga., between Intown Plaza and Asian Square
What You'll Find: Known as The International Corridor, DeKalb County's Buford Highway is a stretch of road connecting Doraville and Chamblee, and it is rich in family-owned restaurants turning out original dishes from around the globe.
"You can't go two blocks down Buford Highway without feeling like you are in a different country. The signs change, the language changes, some of these restaurants you go into you're not even going to get English on the menus, which is something really cool and unique," says Discover DeKalb's Matthew Smith.
The Bikes and Bites rally will give cyclists the chance to experience the communities' fares in a 4.5-mile police-escorted ride. Participants will make two stops along the route for water and international cuisine including Vietnamese sesame balls filled with mung bean paste by Viet Tofu, barbecue pork buns by Oriental Pearl and bubble milk tea by Sweet Hut Bakery.
Helpful Details: Performance Bicycle Atlanta will be offering pre-ride tune-ups. Because it covers hilly terrain, the ride may not be suitable for novice cyclists. For price and registration details, click here .
Taste of Chamblee
When: September 12, 3:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m.
Where to Meet: At the corner of Peachtree Road and Broad Street in downtown Chamblee, Ga.
What You'll Find: Incorporated in 1908, the city of Chamblee has long been run on dairies, railroads and the military. Benefitting the city's largest local nonprofit, which offers underinsured Georgians with vision and hearing care, this year's Taste of Chamblee will celebrate the city's diverse epicurean community as restaurants like The Mad Italian, Lenox Cupcakes, Penang Malaysian Cuisine and Pho 24 offer tastings of their specialties for $1-$5 per sample. Classic, antique and modified cars will be on show at the 5 th Annual Modified Cruise-In from noon until 5:00 p.m. Pottery, paintings, sculpture, photography, jewelry, furniture and other crafts by regional artists will be available for purchase at the Art Walk.
A Kid Zone will keep the children busy with face painting and an inflatable play area. And live music by the band GLOW will kick off the Food Truck Round Up at 6:00 p.m.
Helpful Details: Admission is free with food and drink tickets for sale on site. Parking is available at Chamblee Plaza with a trolley running to the festival entrance.
Atlanta WarBird Weekend
When: September 12-13, 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.
Where to Meet: DeKalb Peachtree Airport
What You'll Find: Celebrating and remembering the men, women and machines of World War II, the Atlanta WarBird Weekend pays tribute to America's veterans with a tarmac full of vintage aircraft and family activities. On the site of what was once Naval Air Station Atlanta, you will find a fleet of P-51 Mustangs, a B-17 "Memphis Belle," a British RAF Spitfire, a Searman biplane, a German FW 190 and other famous WWII aircraft available for photos and tours.
Rides will be available in the Dixie Wing's P-51, Douglas SBD-5 dive-bomber, LT-6 Mosquito, PT-26 and DC-3. Uniforms and equipment will be on display, and the Dixie Wing PX will offer authentic military dog tags as souvenirs. The Atlanta History Center, Museum of Aviation History and Zoo Atlanta will sponsor family activities including climbing through an F-15 Eagle cockpit and creating your own aircraft nose art.
DeKalb-Peachtree Airport also has a playground with swings and slides. In the evening, head over to WWII fighter pilot themed eatery 57 th Fighter Group Restaurant, adjacent to the airport and owned by Georgia Aviation Hall of Fame recipient Pat Epps.
Helpful Details: Atlanta WarBird Weekend is not an airshow. The event is free to the public, and parking is available for $10 per car, cash only. No pets allowed. Ground tours of aircraft will be available for a fee and can be purchased in advance here .
Atlanta Greek Festival
When: September 26-27, 5:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. Thursday, 5:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m. Friday, 11:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. Saturday, 11:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. Sunday
Where to Meet: Greek Orthodox Cathedral, 2500 Clairmont Road, N.E., Atlanta, Ga.
What You'll Find: When Greeks use the word "Kefi," they are referring to being consumed by music and the joys of life. Sometimes you just have to shout OPA!
At the Atlanta Greek Festival, prepare to do just that. Enjoy a selection of more than 14 traditional dishes including Moussaka (layers of potato, eggplant and ground beef topped with a creamy b√©chamel white sauce), Beef Kapama (beef simmered with tomatoes, wine and spices), Gyro Sandwiches, Souvlaki and lamb by the pound.
Local band Alpha-Omega Sound will play the best in traditional and contemporary Greek music as the cathedral's award winning dance troupe take you on a journey through Greek heritage and traditions that cover Cyprus, Greece and Asia Minor. Greek wine will be available for purchase by the glass, and vendors will be set up with authentic Greek wares such as sailor hats, ceramics, books, jewelry, Olympic souvenirs and more.
Helpful Details: Tickets are $5 for adults, children 12 & under free. Seniors 65 and older are free on Friday. The price of admission does not include food. Hot dogs will be available for guests whose palates are less adventurous. Free parking and shuttle buses are available from Century Center Office Park on Clairmont Road, adjacent to I-85. For early ticket purchasing, click here .
International Food and Music Festival
When: October 17, noon to 6:00 p.m.
Where to Meet: Northlake Mall, 4800 Briarcliff Road, Atlanta, Ga.
What You'll Find: A celebration of the more than 32 countries represented in DeKalb County, this outdoor festival pays tribute to the area's multi-ethnic populations with dance troupes, musicians and foods from around the globe. Set up in front of Macy's, this year's entertainment includes belly dancers, The Dragon Dancers, a disc jockey and student performers from area schools. Food and goods vendors will represent the Caribbean, Mexico, Africa, Somalia, India and Vietnam.
Old-fashioned mustangs will be on display, and area non-profits like Refugee Coffee Company and Friends of Refugees will be on site sharing the stories of how they embrace and encourage the county's residents in need. Children's activities will include face painting, balloon animals, bouncy houses, live animals and a video game truck.
Helpful Details: Admission is free with food or goods for a fee per vendor. If you are interested in participating as an entertainer or vendor, call 404-371-3681.
For more information on these upcoming festivals and other activities in DeKalb County and the Atlanta area, visit AtlantasDeKalb.com .
